welcome.name: Jared Gonzalez
welcome.title: Student of Computer Science
welcome.subtitle: Welcome to My Developer Portfolio
welcome.description: Hello! I'm currently a student passionate about web development and data science, committed to creating innovative and practical technological solutions. This portfolio showcases my work, learning journey, and dedication to continuous improvement.

about.historyText1: My interest in technology has been shaped by how software can solve everyday problems and generate an impact on people
about.historyText2: I work with an analytical and disciplined mindset, focused on learning continuously and building well-structured, creative and functional solutions.
about.responsibleLogistics: Responsible for the development of the Logistics Report and Product Report modules of the ERP of Santa Priscila using technologies such as Vue and Laravel.
about.highSchoolDiploma: Technical High School Diploma in IT Services

projects.title: My Projects
projects.subtitle: A selection of my best work and experiments

projects.title: Unknown Titan
projects.subtitle: Game Development
projects.description: Project developed for the NASA Space Apps Challenge with Godot, focused on exploring the possibility of life on Titan through an interactive experience. The game integrates scientific data to capture children's attention.

projects.title: A Second Chance
projects.subtitle: Game Development
projects.description: Video game winner of the PyWeekend hackathon at ESPOL, built in Godot with a focus on agile mechanics and dynamic aesthetics. About SDG 15, where the player finds themselves in a dystopian future affected by climate change.

projects.title: Prime Detector ASM
projects.subtitle: Low-level Programming
projects.description: Assembly program (MIPS) that determines if a number is prime using low-level optimizations to improve performance.

projects.title: RSA CLI Tool
projects.subtitle: Cryptography
projects.description: CLI to explain and implement RSA: key generation, encryption and decryption with a focus on mathematical clarity and reproducible tests.

projects.title: iSponsor
projects.subtitle: Web Application
projects.description: Web platform to connect with Donors and Sponsored individuals. Built with React and Supabase, allowing Sponsored individuals to search for sponsorship opportunities and Care Homes to manage donations.

projects.title: Weather Dashboard
projects.subtitle: Real-time Data Visualization
projects.description: Interactive real-time weather dashboard. Developed with React and Material-UI, it integrates live weather data with an intuitive, responsive interface and advanced data visualization components.

projects.title: EcoWarning
projects.subtitle: Environmental Alert System
projects.description: Environmental alert system that monitors and notifies about environmental disasters in the environment. Collaborative project focused on sustainability and environmental awareness, developed with Vue.js and PHP.

projects.title: Lexic Analizador GO
projects.subtitle: Lexical Analyzer
projects.description: Lexical analyzer of Go developed with Python and its PLY (Python Lex-Yacc) library. Performs syntactic and lexical analysis of source code, generating tokens and error reports.

projects.title: Landing Page
projects.subtitle: Modern Web Design
projects.description: Modern and responsive landing page developed with Firebase for backend and Tailwind CSS for styling. Clean design optimized for conversions with fluid animations.

testimonials.title: Testimonials
testimonials.subtitle: What my colleagues and mentors say about my work

testimonials.quote: Showed remarkable learning ability in a short time and applied it effectively to team projects.
testimonials.name: Marcos del Rosario

testimonials.quote: He was a key figure in making technical decisions during project development.
testimonials.name: Jefferson Davalos

testimonials.quote: He is known for his determination and unwavering commitment to delivering high-quality results in every task he undertakes
testimonials.name: Jose Zambrano
